III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & Rule 126. The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
Section administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and other
Description staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement and to
provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/09/24, Staff 1 had hugged Youth A from behind on Pod 8.
Supervisor on the overnight shift sleeps during his shift.
Investigation Complainant was anonymous.
Clinical Director 1 was interviewed at the facility on
12/12/2024. Administrator 1 reported she is not aware of any
incident involving staff member hugging any youths on Pod 8.
Clinical Director is the assigned therapist to the pod and Youth A
has never reported any staff hugging him. Clinical Director is not
aware of any reports regarding Supervisor sleeping on shift.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 12/12/2024. Youth A
has been at the facility for 6 months and is currently on stage
three in the program. Youth A is placed on Pod 8 and there are
four other youths with him on the pod. Youth A reported he is
participating in weekly individual and group therapy. Youth A said
staff are always supervising and in the daytime, there are two staff
on the pod. At times there is one staff supervising. He denied Staff
1 or any other staff hugging him or any other youth on the pod. He
further denied witnessing any staff sleeping during their shift.
Youth A reported all his needs are being met.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 12/12/2024. Youth B
has been at the facility for one year. Youth B denied witnessing
Staff 1 hug Youth A or any other youth. Youth B reported staff are
always supervising, staff are very supportive, and he has not
witnessed any staff member sleeping during the night shift. Youth
B reported feeling safe and all his needs are being met.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 12/20/2024. Youth C
has been at the facility for 6 months and is placed on Pod 3. Youth
C denied witnessing Staff 1 hug Youth A, or Supervisor sleeping
during night shift. Youth C reported staff are always on the pod
2

supervising, all his needs are being met, he is participating in
individual and group therapy, and he feels safe.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 12/27/2024. Staff 1 has
been working at the facility for 2 years. She denied any incidents
of her hugging any youths or any inappropriate touching occurring.
She only uses verbal redirection with the youths. She denied any
incidents involving Youth A. Staff 1 denied witnessing or hearing
that Supervisor sleeps during night shift.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility on 12/27/2024.
Supervisor has been working at the facility for 12 years. He
typically works midnight shift, and during his shift he will check in
with staff on the pods. He denied sleeping during his shift.
Supervisor also denied witnessing Staff 1, or any other staff hug
Youth A. Supervisor said Youth A has never reported any hugging
or inappropriate touching by Staff 1.
Manager was interviewed at the facility on 12/27/2024. Manager
denied witnessing or having any reports of Staff 1 hugging Youth
A. He reported Staff 1 is always very professional and is by the
book. He did not have any concerns for Staff 1. He further denied
any incidents or reports about Supervisor sleeping during midnight
shift.
JJ Worker was interviewed via telephone on 02/07/2025. JJ
Worker reported Youth A has been at the facility for 8 months and
he has never reported any concerns regarding staff. She said
Youth A is doing well in the program and she did not express any
concerns for the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• The agency Supervision Policy: Staff shall maintain within
continuous line of sight supervision when youths are
outside of their bedrooms. Line of sight supervision is
defined as “coordinating all activities of the residents under
your supervision so that visible contact is maintained, and
the actions of resident are under observation at all times.”
• Professional Boundaries: Employee Relationships with
Youth Policy: • A professional relationship implies that the
relationship does not extend outside professional duties
and that all planned interactions between staff and youth
only occur during the course of work and are authorized by
the treatment or service plan, and or agency procedures.
• Staff 1’s Personnel File- There was no disciplinary record.
• Supervisor Personnel File-There are no disciplinary record.
3

Analysis The facility was found in compliance as per youths and staff
interviews and documentation review. There was no evidence
found that a staff member was hugging youth and supervisor is
sleeping on the night shift.
Technical Assistances:
Technical assistance was provided regarding updating the
facility’s policy for professional boundaries to be specific regarding
prohibiting staff giving youths hugs.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Facility and premises maintenance
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4407
Section (1) A facility and premises shall be maintained in a clean,
Description comfortable, and safe condition. The facility shall be located on
land that is properly drained.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation One pod smells like sewage.
Investigation Clinical Director was interviewed at the facility on 12/12/2024.
Clinical Director reported she is not aware of any issues with
plumbing or incidents regarding sewage smell. She meets with the
youths on the pod daily and they have not reported smelling
sewage or any other issues.
Youth A, Youth B, were interviewed on 12/12/2024 and they both
denied smelling sewage or plumbing issues.
Youth C was interviewed on 12/20/2024, and he denied any
issues with sewage smell or plumbing.
Staff 1 and Supervisor denied any concerns regarding plumbing
or sewage smell at the facility.
Manager was interviewed on 12/20/2024, and he denied any
current reports of plumbing issues or sewage smell. He said if
there is a plumbing issue a work order will be completed,
submitted to maintenance, who then would immediately inspect
and fix the problem.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on 12/12/2024. A walk through was
completed in the hallway leading to Pod 7 and Pod 8. Observed
4

Pod 8 and Pod 7 common area, bedrooms, classroom, gym area,
and they were all found to be clean and odor free.
Document reviewed:
• Administrator reviewed maintenance records for the facility
and the last record found is dated 08/08/2024: replaced
valve and floodtrol valve on toilet on pod 2 cell 4. Rebuild
sloan valve on hallway toilet, rebuild sloan valve on pod 2
cell 3 toilet.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and walkthrough there was no evidence found that the
facility smells like sewage or has any plumbing issues.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
